items.title: Nvidia could drastically reduce supply of RTX 5000 gaming GPUs in 2026, cutting production by up to 40%
items.description: Nvidia may cut RTX 5000 series GPU production by up to 40% in 2026, impacting gaming hardware availability amid ongoing supply concerns.[1]

items.title: Trump Media announces $6 billion merger with nuclear fusion company TAE Technologies
items.description: Trump Media & Technology Group has agreed to a $6 billion merger with nuclear fusion firm TAE Technologies, marking a major move in energy tech.[4]

items.title: DoorDash launches Zesty, an AI social app for restaurant discovery
items.description: DoorDash introduced Zesty, an AI-powered app using generative AI for personalized restaurant recommendations based on social trends and user data.[2]

items.title: Ford shifts battery focus from cars to data centers with 20GWh capacity plans
items.description: Ford is redirecting battery production toward data centers, planning a massive 20GWh capacity to support AI and computing demands.[1]

items.title: Appleâ€™s new AI tool generates 3D scenes from photos in under a second for VR
items.description: Apple unveiled an AI tool that creates 3D scenes from photos in seconds, advancing VR memory experiences akin to Star Trek's Holodeck.[1]

items.title: Google unveils Gemini 3 Flash for high-speed AI applications
items.description: Google released Gemini 3 Flash, a lightweight AI model for low-latency tasks like real-time translation and coding, reducing costs.[2]

items.title: Meta launches centralized support hub for Facebook and Instagram account recovery
items.description: Meta introduced a new support hub to help users recover hacked Facebook and Instagram accounts and enhance profile security.[3]

items.title: RAM crisis to impact smartphone specs in 2026 as Samsung doubles DDR5 costs
items.description: Rising DDR5 RAM costs from Samsung may lead to downgraded smartphone specs in 2026, exacerbating the ongoing memory shortage.[1]
